quiz.title: Economics: GDP, Costs, and Trade Theory

questions.question: Which is included in GDP?
questions.explanation: GDP includes government expenditure on goods and services, including salaries paid to public employees, as part of government consumption.

questions.question: Which of the following will increase GDP at market prices but not GDP at factor cost?
questions.explanation: GDP at market prices = GDP at factor cost + indirect taxes − subsidies. So an increase in indirect taxes raises market-price GDP without affecting factor-cost GDP.

questions.question: The capital that is consumed by an economy or a firm in the production process is known as:
questions.explanation: Depreciation (or capital consumption) measures the wear and tear of capital goods used in production.

questions.question: Who propounded the opportunity cost theory of international trade?
questions.explanation: Gottfried Haberler reformulated the theory of comparative advantage in terms of opportunity cost in his 1936 work.

questions.question: GDP deflator is given by:
questions.explanation: GDP deflator = (Nominal GDP / Real GDP) × 100, used to measure inflation in an economy.

questions.question: Wear and tear of capital due to constant use means:
questions.explanation: Depreciation is the loss of value of capital goods (machinery, buildings) due to usage and aging.

questions.question: Value of output minus intermediate consumption is:
questions.explanation: Gross Value Added (GVA) = Value of Output − Intermediate Consumption.

questions.question: Personal income minus personal taxes is:
questions.explanation: Disposable Income = Personal Income − Personal Taxes. It is the amount available for consumption and saving.

questions.question: National income is a --- variable.
questions.explanation: National income is a flow variable—measured over a period of time (e.g., per year).

questions.question: GNP measured in terms of current market prices is called:
questions.explanation: Nominal GNP is measured at current market prices, without adjusting for inflation.

questions.question: The term “Classical Economics” was first used by:
questions.explanation: Karl Marx coined the term “Classical Economics” to refer to the economic thought of Smith, Ricardo, and others.

questions.question: Primary sector includes:
questions.explanation: The primary sector involves extraction of raw materials and agriculture—farming, fishing, mining, forestry.
